sourceMeaningMnemonic: You fly <radical>north</radical> to the <radical>moon</radical> and break your <kanji>back</kanji> when you finally land on it. You weren’t braced for impact so when you hit the moon, your back took all of the impact.
meaningInfo: Imagine flying north to the moon. Feel the force of being rocketed through space on your journey. Now feel your spine telescope and your back break. It really hurts.
readingMnemonic:
Your <kanji>back</kanji> hurts so much that the only way to properly explain the pain is in <reading>hai</reading>ku (<ja>はい</ja>) form. 

I flew to the moon.
It is there I broke my back.
My back hurts real bad.
readingInfo: Say this haiku out loud. Memorize it and use this haiku to remember this kanji.
